        <div aria-live=\"polite\" class=\"slick-list draggable\" tabindex=\"0\"><div class=\"slick-track\" style=\"opacity: 1; width: 5760px; transform: translate3d(-960px, 0px, 0px);\"><div                         <div class=\"campus-quote\">\n                                            <p>“The motive and purpose of my writing is <em>the projection of an ideal man</em>. The portrayal of a moral ideal, as my ultimate literary goal, as an end in itself — to which any didactic, intellectual or philosophical values contained in a novel are only the means.”</p>\n                                        </div>\n                                        <div class=\"author\">—&nbsp;Ayn Rand, <span class=\"title\">“The Goal of My Writing,” <em>The Romantic Manifesto</em></span></div>\n                                        \n                                        <a id=\"\" class=\"back-arrow\" href=\"https://campus.aynrand.org/works/1963/01/01/the-goal-of-my-writing\"><span class=\"icon-arrow-next\"></span></a>\n                                    </div>\n                                </div>\n                                <div style=\"clear: both;\"></div>\n                            </div>\n                        </div>\n                    </div><div class=\"js-snack-toggle in-her-words-block slick-slide slick-active\" data-slick-index=\"0\" aria-hidden=\"false\" style=\"width: 960px;\">\n                        <div class=\"container\">\n                            <div class=\"item\">\n                                <div class=\"in-her-words-item-body-copy\">\n                                    <div class=\"quote-wrapper\">\n                                        <div class=\"campus-quote\">\n                                            <p>“Ethics is <em>not</em> a mystic fantasy — nor a social convention — nor a dispensable, subjective luxury, to be switched or discarded in any emergency. Ethics is an <em>objective, metaphysical necessity of man’s survival </em>— not by the grace of the supernatural nor of your neighbors nor of your whims, but by the grace of reality and the nature of life.”</p>\n                                        </div>\n                                        <div class=\"author\">—&nbsp;Ayn Rand, <span class=\"title\">“The Objectivist Ethics,” <em>The Virtue of Selfishness</em></span></div>\n                                        \n                                        <a id=\"InHerWordsQuoteLink\" class=\"back-arrow\" href=\"https://campus.aynrand.org/works/1961/01/01/the-objectivist-ethics\"><span class=\"icon-arrow-next\"></span></a>\n                                    </div>\n                                </div>\n                                <div style=\"clear: both;\"></div>\n                            </div>\n                        </div>\n                    </div><div class=\"js-snack-toggle in-her-words-block slick-slide\" data-slick-index=\"1\" aria-hidden=\"true\" style=\"width: 960px;\">\n                        <div class=\"container\">\n                            <div class=\"item\">\n                                <div class=\"in-her-words-item-body-copy\">\n                                    <div class=\"quote-wrapper\">\n                                        <div class=\"campus-quote\">\n                                            <p>“Love is a response to values. It is with a person’s sense of life that one falls in love — with that essential sum, that fundamental stand or way of facing existence, which is the essence of a personality.”</p>\n                                        </div>\n                                        <div class=\"author\">—&nbsp;Ayn Rand, <span class=\"title\">“Philosophy and Sense of Life,” <em>The Romantic Manifesto</em></span></div>\n                                        \n                                        <a id=\"InHerWordsQuoteLink\" class=\"back-arrow\" href=\"https://campus.aynrand.org/works/1966/01/01/philosophy-and-sense-of-life\"><span class=\"icon-arrow-next\"></span></a>\n                                    </div>\n                                </div>\n                                <div style=\"clear: both;\"></div>\n                            </div>\n                        </div>\n                    </div><div class=\"js-snack-toggle class=\"item\">\n                                <div class=\"in-her-words-item-body-copy\">\n                                    <div class=\"quote-wrapper\">\n                                        <div class=\"campus-quote\">\n                                            <p>“No matter what corruption he’s taught about the virtue of selflessness, sex is the most profoundly selfish of all acts, an act which he cannot perform for any motive but his own enjoyment . . . an act which is not possible in self-abasement, only in self-exaltation, only in the confidence of being desired and being worthy of desire.”</p>\n                                        </div>\n                                        <div class=\"author\">—&nbsp;Ayn Rand, <span class=\"title\">“The Meaning of Sex,” <em>For the <span>ARI</span></h1>\n\t\t\t<div class=\"block-content\">\n                <p>Aynrand.org is the official website of the Ayn Rand Institute (ARI), the source for information on the life, writings and work of novelist-philosopher Ayn Rand.</p>\n<p>Headquartered in Irvine, California, with a second office in Alexandria, Virginia, ARI offers educational experiences based on Ayn Rand’s books and ideas for a variety of audiences, including students, educators, policymakers and lifelong learners. ARI also engages in research and advocacy efforts, applying Rand’s ideas to current issues and seeking to promote her philosophical principles of reason, rational self-interest and laissez-faire capitalism.</p>\n<p>ARI is composed of a dedicated Board of Directors and an energetic staff of more than 55 people.
